Title:
CHARACTERIZATION OF Colletotrichum spp. CAUSAL AGENT OF
ANTHRACNOSE IN PASSION FRUIT (Passiflora edulis f. flavicarpa) IN
BRAZIL
Keywords:
Colleotrichum fructicola, Colletotrichum theobromicola,
Colletotrichum brevisporum.
Abstract:
Anthracnose, caused by various species from the genus
Colletotrichum, is one limiting factor for passion fruit production due
to its severe incidence in leaves and fruits. The objective of the
present study was to identify the species of Colletotrichum associated
with anthracnose in fruits of passion fruit based on molecular and
morphological characterization. Nine Colletotrichum isolates were
obtained from fruits with typical symptoms of the disease collected in
the state of Alagoas, Brazil. For molecular characterization,
multi-locus phylogenetic analyses were performed with partial sequences
of the GAPDH, β-TUB, ACT, CAL, SOD, CHS genes and ITS-rDNA region. For
morpho-cultural characterization, mycelial growth, coloration of
colonies, size and shape of conidia and appressoria of the selected
isolates, were evaluated. Multi-locus analyses along with
morpho-cultural characteristics confirmed the species C. fructicola, C.
theobromicola and C. brevisporum as responsible for causing anthracnose
in fruits of passion fruit in the state of Alagoas, Brazil.
